title: (x) Credit card numbers - OCR {Stephen}
content:
Hello guys. This is probably super easy.   
Which is the font used on credit cards?   
\*this is not my card / these are fake numbers from an ad.   
\*\*I did a search on the website and couldn't find it.   
 ![c card number](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110033546im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/42919.jpg)
author: fdavid

comments.content:
ok thanks...is this type of font illegal to own?   
Just curious; I was actually trying to find a font that would have clinical look.   
thank you.

I personally don't know if there are any fonts, per se, that are "illegal to own". There   
has been a reluctance here, though, to provide info to anyone who might possibly be   
trying to duplicate currency or credit/debit cards � for obvious reasons.   
   
I emphasize the word _possibly_, because that doesn't appear to be your agenda at   
all � but ya never know ...   
   
I'm surprised that nobody else has suggested fonts that might meet your objective.   
Check out some of the [Test Pilot Collective](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110033546/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/testpilot/?idtype=foundry&itemsperpage=55&resultcount=55&page=1) offerings for an OCR clinical look.

thanks for the suggestion Mike. If the monitor of this section feels that my post is somewhat 'uncomfortable' please go ahead and delete the thread.   
thanks again.
